Sheya Hertz is a Human Resources and Organizational Consultant in WeFi and in various other companies. She is supporting senior managers in organization development and org growth, e.g. change and transition, people related processes, management and leadership development, compensation and benefit, hiring etc. Prior to joining WeFi, Sheya worked at Intel for 14 years in several groups within the Human Resources department, such as Organizational Development, Training, Compensation and Global Benefits design. Sheya's work in Israel had a significant impact inside and outside Intel on the local market which adopted many of the cultural and benefits programs that she designed. Sheya started her career as the culture and social department manager in the Ministry of Absorption in Israel, part of her role was to design culture and social programmes for young immigrants to Israel. Sheya has two Bachelor's degrees in Psychology and in Behavioral Science, Management and Economics from Ben Gurion University of the Negev. She has a Masters Degree in Business Administration from Ben-Gurion University and she is a certified CTI life coach. Sheya lectures and conduct workshops in several fields in HR to Human Resource professionals, managers and leader in various organizations.

Jim Farman
Business Development Partner Programs
Washington DC Metro Area, United States, North America
Twitter
LinkedIn
Facebook
Recently joined Amazon Web Services, Partner Business Development in February 2020. Jim is a tenured cloud and hybrid IT industry professional with over 20 years of experience focusing on Service Providers, Enterprise, and Public Sector markets. Jim has held senior Sales, Product Management, and Business Development positions for CenturyLink, ePlus Technology, Savvis Cloud & Colocation, and Qwest Communications. While serving as a Global Sales Engineering Director at CenturyLink; Jim’s team designed secure hybrid IT and cloud solutions for global enterprise accounts providing the onramp for digital transformation. In previous roles, Jim lead Product Management for CenturyLink’s Cloud Business responsible for IaaS Product Services and Go-To-Market strategy. He has also held various senior product manager roles focused on Hosted Private Cloud, Managed Network and Security Services for Public Sector, MPLS/IP WAN, BCDR, and Advanced IT Services.
Maximiliano Firtman
Author
Argentina, Sao Paulo, Brazil
Twitter
LinkedIn
Facebook
Max Firtman is a mobile+web developer, trainer, speaker, and writer. He has written many books, including Programming the Mobile Web (available in a second edition) and the recent High Performance Mobile Web, published by O’Reilly Media. Max is a well-known professional in the mobile-web community, blogging about mobile-web platforms on Mobilexweb.com and keeping compatibility tables updated at Mobilehtml5.org. He is a frequent speaker at conferences, including QCon, Mobilism, OSCON, Velocity, Fluent, Google Developer Day, JSConf, GOTO, AdobeCamp, and many other events around the world. Max has been widely recognized for his work in the mobile-web community by Adobe Community Professional, Microsoft IE User Agent, Nokia Developer Champion, BlackBerry Elite, and more. He teaches mobile HTML5 and performance trainings for top companies around the world and founded ITMaster, an IT-training company.

April Wright
Author
Boston, Massachusetts, United States
Twitter
LinkedIn
Facebook
April C. Wright is a hacker, O’Reilly author, teacher, and community leader who has been breaking, making, fixing, and defending the security of global critical communications and connections for over 25 years. She’s an international speaker and trainer, educating and advising on matters of privacy and information security with the goal of safeguarding the digital components we rely on every day. April has held roles on defensive, operational, adversarial, and development teams throughout her career, and she has spoken and contributed to numerous worldwide security conferences including BlackHat, DEF CON USA and DEF CON China, DerbyCon, Hack in Paris, DefCamp Romania, and ITWeb South Africa as well as for the US government and industry organizations such as OWASP and ISSA. She has started multiple small businesses, including a nonprofit, handles communications for DEF CON Groups community outreach, and in 2017 cofounded a popular local Boston community event (DC617). April has collected dozens of certifications to add capital letters at the end of her name and almost died in Dracula’s secret staircase. She once read in the Onion that researchers at the University of North Carolina released a comprehensive report in 2014 confirming her status as the “most significant and interesting person currently inhabiting the earth,” and it was on “teh internet,” so it must be true.
Emily Buckman
Global Strategic Consultant
Oxshott, Surrey, United Kingdom
Twitter
LinkedIn
Facebook
Emily Buckman is a global strategic consultant at Urban Airship, responsible for working with clients to develop digital marketing strategies to address their business objectives. An evangelist for omni-channel customer experience, Emily has held senior roles at Samsung in customer engagement, most recently as UK Head of CRM and Data, driving consumer retention through digital platforms such as Email and the myGalaxy app. Emily also held marketing leadership roles at Telefonica Digital, BSkyB (growing SkyGo’s user base) and has worked with major UK retail brands including Nandos, O2 Arena, The Body Shop and River Island to leverage mobile data for targeted engagement. Emily holds a B.A. Honours in European Marketing and Languages from Roehampton University and received a CAM Diploma in Marketing Communications/Advanced Online Marketing from the Chartered Institute of Marketing.

Stoyan Panayotov is a full time student currently getting his bachelor’s in finance from University of Economics - Varna. He has been lucky enough to start a few startups and see the hard work payoff and see failure. He enjoys the collaboration with smart people to figure out how to create value for a customer in their startup. Stoyan does business development for EasierEnglish.bg and Awardev, a web development company that specialize the needs of small to mid-sized businesses. When he’s not looking for startup adventures, he likes to spend time with friends, travel, bike and drink tea. Ed Goodman
Director of Cambridge Grind
Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, United Kingdom
Twitter
LinkedIn
Facebook
Ed Goodman is a business start-up mentor who’s worked with over 10,000 start-ups to successfully build their knowledge of financial management, social media, networking and more. He has also delivered keynote presentations and workshops at large-scale seminars and exhibitions, including the MADE Festival, Business Start-Up Show, and other events at Earls Court, ExCel London and The National Space Centre. Through independent consultancy and mentoring, along with aligned partnerships, he has worked with multinational corporations including Barclays, Google, Sage, Intuit and more. In 2012, Ed co-founded the Cambridge Business Lounge, a co-working space and support hub for start-ups and small businesses. He also regularly blogs on small business topics, including ‘The A–Z Guide to Starting a Business’, as well as being a contributor on the BBC, podcasts as well as other established business blogs. January 2015 sees the release of Ed's first book "New Business, Next Steps - The All In One Guide to Managing, Marketing and Growing Your Small Business", published by Pearson.

Todd Sherman â€“ Chief Marketing Officer Todd has 20 years of successful experience in executive management, sales, marketing and technical roles in both established F100 companies and startup organizations. At Point Inside, Todd manages all aspects of B2B and B2C messaging and strategic partnerships for the company's destination content platform. Prior to Amazon, Todd held executive sales and business development positions at NetMotion Wireless, iCopyright.com and SGI (formerly Silicon Graphics). Todd graduated from MIT with a degree in mechanical engineering.

Eran Naveh
VP Product Strategy
Twitter
LinkedIn
Facebook
Eran is responsible of WeFi's product strategy, management and roadmap. Eran has over 25 years of experience fixed and mobile telecoms operations and vendors. Prior to joining WeFi, Eran was consulting on business and technology strategy for mobile operators and Internet service providers, such as Partner Communications Company/Orange Israel (NASDAQ: PTNR) and 012 Smile (Nasdaq: SMLC). From 1998 to 2005, Eran was pivotal in the launch and success of Partner Communications/Orange Israel (NASDAQ: PTNR), focusing on the (then futuristic) data service and content applications. Eran established an internal R&D department in Partner and from 2001 until 2005 was the company's Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Prior to the foundation of Orange in 1998, Eran was founder and VP R&D for Aretê Information Technologies, that developed a cutting-edge artificial intelligence based search engine. Aretê operated from 1995 to 1998. From 1986 to 1991, Eran led the development and launch of the Israeli Defense Forces Strategic Data Communications network.
